New Records: Egypt achieved a 4-0 victory over Botswana in their 2025 AFCON qualifier match.
Mohamed Elneny reached his 100th cap for Egypt during the match.
Key Match Events: Egypt scored four goals without conceding in the match.
Mohamed Salah, Mahmoud Trezeguet, and Mohamed Hamdi each scored a goal in the first half.
In the second half, Mostafa Fathi and Ibrahim Adel scored the fourth and fifth goals respectively.
Pre-Game Insights: Botswana was unprepared and had lost their previous match, while Egypt had won their opening game.
Hossam Hassan made several lineup changes due to injuries and absences.
Post-Match Reflections: Egypt's win moved them to the top of their group with six points and a clean record.
The match highlighted the depth of Egypt's squad with several young players contributing.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was significant for milestone achievements, including 100 caps and a dominant team performance.
Others: The article provided detailed coverage of the match, including live updates and key moments.
